Reviews.Title: “A Must Visit”
Reviews.Author: goldilocks65
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent Hotel. My husband and I stayed here for two nights in April, 2012. The Hotel is in excellent condition and classily decorated. Our room was large, bright, airy and in first class condition, with a double and a single bed. Extra blankets were available if needed too. There was plenty of hanging space for clothes and a safe for personal use. There was also a well stocked fridge. The bathroom was highly commendable and had a great shower with a strong spray. There were a number of obligatory toiletries which were much appreciated, plus a hairdrier and a fantastic magnifying mirror for shaving or applying makeup. The breakfast room was bright, pleasant and well attended by waiting staff. A good selection of food was on offer including hot scrambled, and boiled, eggs, tomatoes, ham, cheese, pastries, cereal, etc etc. Being Brits we weren't too keen on the strong coffee that Italians seem to drink, however, the staff were more than willing to make us our favourite cafe latte which was much appreciated. A variety of fruit juices, tea, water and milk were also available. Wi-Fi is available at a very modest charge. The Hotel is in a fabulous central location in Rome for seeing most of the well-known tourist attractions. 10-15 mins walk to The Spanish Steps and about 20 mins walk to The Trevi Fountain (at our leisurely speed). Just round the corner from the Hotel you can pick up the open-top buses for sight-seeing. Lots of great cafes, restaurants and shops in the immediate neighbourhood as well. Would highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Nathan B
Reviews.Content: Extremely comfortable accommodations at Hotel Anglo Americano. We arrived after an easy commute from the airport via Termini. We were welcomed by a friendly, helpful staff and settled in to a quiet, modern room. Great location near Metro, food, shopping and landmarks. The icing on the cake was waking up to a great shower and a delicious breakfast. The only way to start a long day of walking and site-seeing. I will definitely book a stay on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fair price but not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: mike w
Reviews.Content: I had a perfectly reasonable stay at this hotel. Location is central, rooms are clean, staff are efficient and friendly. However, this hotel is not four star and whoever gave it four stars I assume is driving around in a nice car. Why do I say this? The breakfast is average, the wifi is confused (you have to go to an http address to log out or you continue to be charged), when I arrived at my floor (3rd) there were no signs telling you which way the room numbers went. There were no shelves or drawers for clothes in my room (just wardrobes). Some of the light fittings in my room were very loosely fitted, the rooms themselves were not that well insulated for sound so I could easily hear my neighbours coming and going. But these are all minor issues but it's silly really. This is a decent good value hotel that I would stay at again for the budget. But it is not a 4 star hotel. If you're looking for a comfortable, well located (central), good value hotel - this is a decent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Abigail D
Reviews.Content: What a great trip! I just visited in early March and was very happy with the accommodations. It's a great location, friendly staff, and nice modern rooms. It was a quick trip from the airport, easy to find after strolling the windy streets all day, and comfortable quiet rooms. The staff was very gracious and helpful with all questions, directions, and suggestions. I would highly recommend and definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Not so nice”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK. But the service is terrible. The man at the front desk is rude and unhelpful. Not just to us; we listened as we sat in the lobby and his comments to other guests and his directions are exceedingly useless. He sent us on a wild goose chase and it was only after we stoppped in 3 local establishments that we finally tracked down what we were looking for. Furthermore, they are crooks. They (he) cheated us on our bill. We had a reservation for a set price and they overcharged us (for an extra night, negating the "good" deal we had) and then refused us and the credit card company to make it right. Very slick.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel located near everything”
Reviews.Author: ColletteCR
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was in an excellent safe area with great shopping and dining nearby. The breakfast buffet had great variety and we were able to walk to all the sites we wanted to see (The Forum, Colosseum, Spanish steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon and even Vatican City) Vatican City and the Colosseum are a little bit of a walk so taking the Metro home for only 1 Euro is a great option. The metro station is very close. We stayed one night and would have liked to stay more. The rooms were clean and sized well and we had our own private bathroom. The taxi ride is affordable (about 8 Euros). Just be sure to actually get in the correct Taxi line and ensure your luggage is also included in the fare. In Naples the taxis all add 2 euros per suitcase, but I didn't have this issue in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: d_atlas
Reviews.Content: A very good value for money hotel. Rooms are recently renovated. Staff very helpful to us. The hotel is situated in a central spot. Most of the monuments, piazzas etc were within walking distance. We would definetely stay there again in my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Franica C
Reviews.Content: For a four star hotel it was very worth it. The hotel was always clean, the service was good and the breakfast was also good. It is also in a very great location, in the middle of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value.”
Reviews.Author: YanushkaEurope
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in this hotel before it's been renovated and indeed there were some changes:nice bathrooms, sound proof rooms, receptions area. Although the rooms are small they are comfortable, breakfast is OK, would return anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Definately NOT a 4-star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kira444
Reviews.Content: Booked with points, hoping bad reviews were for the pre-renovated hotel. Pros: Excellent location, room was clean, plumbing worked great, bathroom featured bidet, towel-warmer, and great tile shower. Cons: Triple room unbelievably cramped, even for European standards; beds were very hard, like camping on the ground; evening front desk clerk was unbelievably rude, refusing to help locate a corkscrew, charging us a full-day's wi-fi at 10pm, knowing it shut off at midnight, etc. Breakfast was what one would expect at 2-star motel. When we left, the morning clerk tried to charge for wi-fi, which you can only get when you pay in advance, and then tried to charge an additional room-tax, saying it wasn't covered in my voucher. He pointed to a voucher from a different company to prove the point. I refused to pay until I spoke with my card's customer service. He threatened to call the police and then sent the bell-hop out to get my husband. I later verified that the tax was indeed paid in my prepaid booking. If not for the extreme rudeness and extortion attempts, it would have rated 3 stars if classed as 3-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice renewed hotel 1 minute from Metro”
Reviews.Author: pabax
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very good location, just 1 minute walk to Barberini Metro station (Line A) and ~7 minutes walk to Fontana di Trevi. Nice renewed rooms a little bit on the small size. Cons: Our room was really hot (air conditioning in the winter is set to Heat only so we didn't turn it on) and we needed to open a window which caused the room to be just a little bit noisy but it didn't really bother us. The breakfast could have been better for a 4* hotel. WIFI is available but not free of charge. 1EUR for 2 hour (you don't need to spend all of those hours immediately). Overall: We had a great stay and I would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: lironhallak
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights in January. Its a very nice, clean and well kept hotel. The rooms are small but very comfortable, nothing too fancy but still nicely designed. In fact, most features in the hotel can be described the same way, including the breakfast. The staff were very patient and helpful with our constant questions and inquiries about what to do now. The main thing about the hotel is its location, a small distance from most of the main attractions of the city, and from the Metro line that takes you to Vatican City.

Reviews.Title: “Good option”
Reviews.Author: YoniG
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Our room was fairly big, and had 2 windows with view to the street and the Barberini Palace. Morning staff was some what anemic in service, and breakfast staff needed some "warming up", but the service in total was very good. Light breakfast- omelet, tomatoes, lettuce, cheese and ham. Don't settle for the coffee from the machine, but ask for one from the barista. There are about 100 channels on the TV, non of which in English!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: zucc999
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in January; Helpful Staff- Within walking distance to Fontana di Trevi, Piazza di Spagna, Termini Station (which is very essential). Very close to Piazza Barberini where a visit to Pepy's Snack Bar is highly recommended! (corner shop). Only B'fast was limited otherwise, great place to stay. Hotel recently refurbished so furnishing is up to standard and 10/10 for cleanliness! Would def recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Clean”
Reviews.Author: sweeetiepie33
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of nights in the beginning of October 2011. The hotel has a good location, about 10 minutes (leisurely) walking to the Trevi fountain and close to the Spanish Steps. Going the opposite way, about 15 minutes to the Roma Termini, the main train station. The hotel is only steps away from the metro station, which we were able to take to the Colosseum and Vatican City. There are plenty of restaurants and bars close to this hotel. The hotel was clean and well- kept. I stayed in a quad room. It was tight, but neat. There was one queen bed and two singles, a tiny bathroom and thats about it. The beds were not extremely comfortable, but I was tired after all of the activity so I was able to fall asleep anyhow. The service was pretty good. One of the concierges (I can't remember his name! but he was young, thing, spoke English very well!) was very helpful, while others seemed bothered by answering our questions. The service guy was great (our light was out and when we called the front desk he was up to our room within minutes!), and the bellboy was very curteous! Others have commented on a weak breakfast, but it was fine for me. There was a small selection of luncheon meats, (salami, cheese), yogurt, pastries/croissants, and I believe, if I remember correctly, eggs. There was a juice and coffee machine, also with a "barista" that could make fresh cappucino for you! I always snagged some packaged biscotti to put in my purse for a snack later in the day! Overall, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Taner_tr06
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights with full of comfort. Just breakfast species were weak. It is expected to see more kind of foods in the breakfast. Serving personal was very kindly and nice. The hotel just 3 minutes walk to Barberini station and 10-15 minutes walk to sightseeing places. I advice to stay here but please check your bathrooms' height :)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel AA, Rome, November 2011”
Reviews.Author: yershova
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in AA hotel in Rome for a week in November 2011. The hotel has been recently rennovated and I really liked design of the room. Also location is wonderful - you can easily get anywhere - either walking or by underground (station is on the corner, 3 mins walk from the hotel). Staff was friendly and helpful. However, there were few things which disappointed me. There was no printer available to the guests. I had to print out museum vouchers few times and each and every time I had to ask reception staff to do it for me.Once their printer was broken. And I think wi-fi could be free of charge for the hotel's guests. Also breakfast could be better. But generally I have good impression and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding stay with family”
Reviews.Author: Bedbugg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a part of Rome I had not stayed in before. Close to the Spanish Steps and just a short walk to the Trevi Fountain. However, I found it to be a very centrally located property and it had a charm other hotels we have stayed in did not. The front desk can be warm or cold, depending on the time of day, number of people being dealt with and who is working. Overall, I found them to be very helpful, English speaking, but with a bit of an Italian quickness. The hotel is located on a hill and has no parking. Cabs will drop you at the front door, but buses are frowned upon in stopping at the front door. The street is too narrow. The lobby and public areas of the hotel were very clean. The breakfast area was quite nice and had an abundant variety of hot/cold items (eggs, meats, cheese, fruits, cereal, juices, breads, rolls etc) to choose from for breakfast. The wedding party of about 60 people that stayed at the hotel found it to be delightful place to meet and get ready for the day. We met many people from all over the world and the hotel even expanded the area when needed. The only thing that was slow, now and then, was the coffee pot being refilled. The hotel is located just around the corner from a metro station and a short walk to the HARD ROCK CAFÉ. There were many restaurants nearby, so you won’t need to go far to eat. However, getting the front desk to get you a cab is easy and the cost is reasonable if you are interested in going to some places further away. The rooms were spotless and ours, a corner room, had views up the hill and toward the museum and plaza. The beds were very comfortable and the towels were large and fluffy. The bathroom had a shower and bidet and plenty of good lighting. The rooms were equipped with a refrigerator. Locks on the doors were electronic and took a bit of getting used to when returning at night. You do need to leave your room card in the inside holster to keep the lights on. There are English channels on the TV, just asked at the front desk how to access them with your remote; otherwise you will only be able to access Italian and French channels. Can’t say enough about this place and will stay here again on our next trip to Rome. The wedding was wonderful and the hotel did so much for the Bride and Groom and the families in making this a very memorable event!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location.. that is all”
Reviews.Author: dolcengabbana
Reviews.Content: Location was great. Staff were inconsistently in all regards. Required a wheelchair acccessible room and the toilet had no seat on it at all... Wheelchair couldn't get around the bed. Was shown to an even smaller room however the bathroom at least had a seat on the toilet.. The beds were extremely hard and uncomfrotable. The breakfast was very average and ran out of items and cutlery and plates each day. One staff member was particularly rude and each request was met with a very condescending tone or total disinterest, if not blatent rude responses. I watch intereation between an AMerican Female Tourist ask the staff member a question he was so unhelpful and rude told her that he couldn't possibly answer her question as he didn't know her interests or needs tso couldn't advise her what tours could possibly be available in Rome for 1 day. She was shocked. I answered her question for her simple and easily with a number of options.

Reviews.Title: “Husband's 60th Birthday Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Christine P
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic 3 days in Rome and thorough enjoyed our stay in this hotel. Our room was spacious with nice decorative finishes and cleaned every day with fresh towels and anew supply of toiletries. Have read the other reviews on the staff and we strongly disagree - we had our bags carried to our room and the gentlemen on reception were very helpful and friendly. The only problem we came across was the small breakfast room, which did get crowded about 9am - so the next morning we waited until 9.30 and is was fine. Would recommend to anyone wanting to stay in Rome and to be central to all the sights. Don and Christine Proctor

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money. Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Avidan
Reviews.Content: It is not fair that the bad reviews are still publish because the hotel was redecorated and now it's practically new.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect only for the receptionist!”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: Just back from a short stay. Hotel was clean and tidy, breakfast was abundant and you were not spoilt for choice. With the exception of one male receptionist, staff were extremely helpful. When he was asked to print off boarding passes he told me the hotel was too busy and it would have to wait until the next day (I was leaving at 8.00am next day!!). When I insisted he said that I could come back in the afternoon when the reception desk was a bit quieter. Also, I was charged a ’City of Rome’ tax of €18 which my travel agent did not inform me off. When I queried this with Mr Personality he handed me an A4 printed sheet to read in Italian! I paid by credit card and will be investigating this when I get back to Ireland. Hotel is centrally located and is convenient to all the major attractions of Rome. Rome itself is beautiful, plenty to see and do (including an unplanned live adult attraction whilst walking through the park at 11.00am in the morning!) A lot of street sellers around, just put up your hand and walk on, it’s the best way. Be mindful of service charges in the restaurants, you get no warning and it just appears on the bill. Rome is a must for all to see

Reviews.Title: “Central location, basic hotel, could be anywhere.”
Reviews.Author: yesmiss
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel close to all of the tourist spots this is the one for you. It's clean and has all of the facilities you would need. We were sent to this hotel after ours had to close some rooms due to a severe storm, we stayed for one night. Be aware they tried to keep our passports, we insisted they photocopied them instead (we were later told that this was possibly not even legal in Italy), we were conceded about the large number of passports which were just lying about behind the desk, not even in a safe, anyone could have walked in and stolen them! The hotel is fine but not very Roman, it's a very bland, could be anywhere type of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location .. but”
Reviews.Author: send2ram
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this place recently and here are our opinions. Rooms - too small , am surprised at how many can be fitted in a floor But the rooms had new decor with marble flooring, excellent bathroom and flat screen tv. Bed was a bit small for my height (6.2) Staff - Very friendly and hard working especially during mad rush @ b/fast Location - Walking distance to Barbarini station , trevi fountain.. Beware , this hotel seem to be favorite among the tour groups hence it gets crowded and its a fight @ b/fast table. Overall, its good value.

Reviews.Title: “a convenient place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Panos-Anna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Anglo Americano for one week. The room was quite big, and nice. It's next to Barberini square but it's quiet and no noice from the street come up to the room. You can walk to city center without taking the metro, it's very near to spanish steps. Breakfast room is a little small, so one day we had to wait for a table to sit. I think after the reconstruction is a little bit expensive ( we've been there in the past one more time).

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Morten63
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights with my family at Hotel Anglo Americano in July 2011. We had a family room on the top floor. This was not a standard room with two extra beds crammed in, but looked like it had actually been planned as a family room with four beds. The room was of a reasonable size. All in all the hotel was ok, but rather a standard mid-quality hotel. Breakfast was a bit below average. Breakfast in Italy is never a big thing, but plasic glasses, things constantly missing on the not too good buffet and a breakfast room so packed that you often had to queue for a table did not help. We arrived on a Saturday, and the electronic key system had broken down, so we could not get our own key until Monday. Every time we wanted to enter our room, we had to be followed up by someone to open the door for us. A bit inconvenient, but something that the hotel could not help. Except for the breakfast room, service was generally good, the only exception being a elderly, male receptionist who reminded my of the principal in my old school and made me fell a bit nervous...

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, room and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BsPeter
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very good; in the center and quiet. However, it is bad in any other possible aspect: - The bathroom is small, no bath (in an ordinary room), no place to shelve stuff, the water at the shower always overflows. - The breakfast room is too smal; no matter when you come in, it is crouded and noisy; no service at all, tables are not clean; the variety and quality of food is limited, not clean, coffie is not served to the tables so you have to go and wait at the coffie machine. - In the rooms there is no single piece of paper, pen, brochure, phone directory - absolutely nothing! In summary, it is absolutely not what you expect to get in a 4-star hotel - even not in a 3-star hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights in July. Nice clean hotel with decent rooms. The best part of the hotel is the location. You can walk to many of the major attractions in Rome. We are a family of four and our room was big enough to move around in. Bathroom was not huge but spacious enough. The service was good. We would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location”
Reviews.Author: Totallynorton
Reviews.Content: Anywhere down town Rome is busy busy busy. Either way, this hotel has an ok continental breakfast (Complimentary), the rooms are decent, and the tv has a couple of English channels.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Big Room, Nice Breakfast, but marginal service/staff”
Reviews.Author: Temp94611
Reviews.Content: Family of four (10, 8), last minute trip to Italy. We had a great time. Summer time, things were crowded, all the venues have some "VIP" option to skip the lines, well worth the price. Great location. 5 minutes to Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. One minute to all bus stops. Lots of restaurants at all price points within a few blocks. Room was surprisingly spacious with comfortable beds. Shower little odd, open construction, would flood the BR after 2 minutes, we think it was handicap access. Huge Breakfast, again pleasant surprise. Scrambled eggs, cappuccino, etc. Wifi only works in lobby. Grocery store 2 blocks away, great to stock up on "cheap" snacks in the mini fridge. We were little disappointed in staff. Basically just grumpy. Even by European standards. you can look at our review of Hotel Giglio in Florence and Hotel Scandinavia in Venice for comparison. We observed their interaction with other guests as well while using wifi in lobby. "Allen" was the only one who was friendly. Do not expect a concierge type service, they all spoke English and had appropriate brochures and maps. We like the location, room, and breakfast enough would probably consider staying again. Separate issue. We were disappointed by VAS tours, recommended by the hotel. We were stuck due to a Italian holiday and limited train schedule. We expected a "herding" type of tours, but three simultaneous languages, we waited for each language in sequence. For three hours at Pompei we wasted at least 31/2 hours waiting for the tour operator. Would not use again.

Reviews.Title: “bad so so GOOD excellent”
Reviews.Author: Aaron R
Reviews.Content: A solid "good" rating on my Italian hotel scale. Small, clean and nice decor. Reception desk usually busy, business like, don't like to get friendly, so expect short answers to questions and don't get too conversational or you will experience some rudeness, which is typical interaction in many Italian big city, high tourist traffic hotels and restaurants.. Excellent breakfast. Good location, very walkable to Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and generally good staff (save one....well they all have one, don't they?)”
Reviews.Author: Parhakoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and baby daughter in this hotel for our first ever trip to Rome. We did not exactly get off to a welcoming start when i was informed that since one of the hotel floors was having water supply issues, we were being shifted to another hotel! Well....thank you but whatever happened to the good old way of informing beforehand? Anyways, after stressing that this is not being appreciated at all, we were finally accomodated in the same hotel. The front desk was generally quite helpful, esp Alizeh and the bellboy too. There was this one tall gentleman at the front desk who proabably needs to learn a thing or two from his younger colleagues in client management. Anyways, we were given a room on the second floor and i did not see any lift/elevator-so quite some task carrying the baby stroller to and fro every time we were to go out. Rooms were modernly furnished-small by most standards but perhaps OK by European standards. Bedding was generally ok. Breakfast was nothing to much write home about but adequate and would feed most mouths as far as i could tell. Location is perhaps the biggest/sole advantage of this hotel. Practically a few steps from Piazza Barberini (which as some fellow traveller has rightly mentioned, every taxi driver knows) and 7-minute easy stroll to the fascinating Trevi fountain as well as a 10m walk to the Spanish Steps. Taxis are easily available from Piazza Barberini and to every other major attraction that we went to via taxi (Piazza Navona, Pantheon, Colesseum), i did not have to pay more than Euro 5-7 per trip. Vatican is some distance off from the historic part of the city and costs about Euro 30 if i recall correctly. Will probably try a few other hotels near this one next time since location cannot be beat....did i mention location? :-)

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoUniversal2010
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went for a 4 day trip to Rome and we booked this hotel because the price was very attractive for a 4-star hotel in the city centre of Rome. We had a very pleasant stay in a totally renovated hotel with well furnished rooms equipped with air conditioning, refrigerator and noise isolation. The room wasn't big but we had enough space for two persons. Also the bathroom is rather small but still not too small. The location of the hotel is great, just around the corner of Piazza Barberini and at walking distance of all major sights in Rome. We will certainly come back to this hotel in the future!!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely happy with Anglo Americano.”
Reviews.Author: tfcoachtony
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brand spanking NEW. I was scared when my travel agent booked us there after reading the reviews from last year. He assured us that the place is new. He was correct. The place is spotless. This hotels decor is contemporary chic. More like the boutique hotels I have stayed at in NYC or Washington DC. Every modern convienience was put in. The beds were very comfortable and the bathrooms new and clean. My room overlooked the Palazzo Barberini out one window and the Vatican out the other. The staff was also very friendly and extremely helpful at our every need. Example of the staff going over and above thier job: My 17yo sons girlfriend arrived in Rome on a school trip the same week. He didn't know where they were staying or how to get in touch with her. We gave the staff the little information we had, and after several hours of detective work they were able to locate her group and put us in contact with her. OMG amazing ....NO other hotel would have done that. My friends wouldn't have done that. It is obvious that the people in charge of this hotel took seriously the need to overhaul. That they did. I will return to this hotel next year. I give this hotel my highest positive rating. Tony from New Jersey

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, and good breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: wineshding
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as our first stop for our honeymoon and it was a very nice experience. The rooms were fairly contemporary and clean, with a very modern and nice bathroom. The free breakfast every day was enjoyable, they have a cappucino machine for self-serve, eggs, and the usual Italian breakfast foods. The only bad thing was there was no free wi-fi, and cost $2euros for 5 hours or something. It was really close to the subway and train stations, easy to get to the major attractions. Noisy if you leave the window open in the mornings, but overall quite nice for an European hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: KatrinaStumpf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in May 2011. I has been remodeled recently and everything is spotless. The hotel was in a great location, every taxi driver knew how to get to the Barberini Piazza. There were a tons of restaurants within walking distance. The rooms were very clean and new. The showers were incredibly small and the breakfast was limited. But I would recommend staying here while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ..Nice hotel ... Recommended”
Reviews.Author: demtura9
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, central location, close to many attractions, food, restaurants, bus and subway station .. We arrived in the morning, to our surprise we received .. Immediately the room (we were with a baby and it was very important), indicate before that I wrote a lot of miles to the hotel please get a room early even if it is paid, just unfortunately not We responded to our letters, it was very frustrating, but in the end we get what we received . The room was small, but very nice and has everything you need Hotel staff friendly, polite and responded to all our request. Must note the reception guy named Alan, was always nice, smiling, professional and always ready to help. Thank staff hotel, the holiday was great .. Return to Rome this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: PeteAnge8
Reviews.Content: Thia once my wife's and I first visit ti Tome and our choice of hotel, choosen with thr help of this web site was great. Its location uis its biggest plus you can walk to so many attractioins, plus it is so close to so many eating places. our "Standard"room was a little cramped but hey, it was ok! With no balconies its hard on smokers, but all up a great place to base yourself for 4 days in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Chaby2010
Reviews.Content: I would rate the hotel as a 3 star hotel. The location is great and it is a clean hotel. The problem is that it's too expensive for what it offers and you can find better value in other hotels. Rooms are very small and the bath room doest even have a bath tub but only a shower. Breskfat is below aveage and after the first day we decided to not eat there any more even though it was included in the price. The hotel is not a bad choice but I think you can find better.

Reviews.Title: “very good location ,standard room,a little bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: jaca101
Reviews.Content: very good location, near subway, close to the historic center roms are a little bit small for 4stars hotel, but are renovated and clean

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, perfect location, beautiful rooms, wonderful value”
Reviews.Author: meghan365
Reviews.Content: We had booked at the hotel julia around the corner, and after finding the room damp, tiny and kinda yucky, walked around to see if we could find something else. We stumbled upon the hotel Anglo-americano and upon walking in, assumed it would be out of out price range. Much to our surprise, it was completely reasonable. Everything was brand new (all the bad reviews must have been from before the renovations). Definitely 4 star accommodations and the staff was delightful. Could not be in a more central location as well. Seriously, before booking some hotel in Termini (the somewhat gross area that most people that aren't looking to spend a fortune wind up in), check out this hotel. The only thing I could complain about was that the phone in our room didn't work for the first day or two (but hey, nothing ever goes as planned in Rome), and the staff then let me make an international call from another empty room and didn't charge me for it (it was a 45 min call so would have been expensive). Food was great, rooms were spotless.

Reviews.Title: “average with minor faults”
Reviews.Author: Croatia_ZG
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Rome with my family in mid december. Firstly, hotel is on a good location, who ever says that it's location is not good, obviously expected to have hotel on the spanish steps. Hotel is literaly in the middle of everything; around 8-10 minutes to Spanish steps, from where you can walk to Vatican city, like we did. Hotel is around 5 minutes from fontana di Trevi, and some 25-30 minutes from forum Romanum. So, it is actualy very well located. That is also main advantage of the hotel. Although it is a 4* hotel, i would give it 3 stars with, as i stated in the title, minor faults... So, first thing that i didnt like is lack of any bar in hotel. I am not a "bar guy", but i like to sit in the evenig and have a drink with my wife. In Anglo Americano you can forget about it. Secondly, breakfast area is totaly crowded with chairs & tables, and if you are disabled or have small children, this may be a big problem. Breakfast is for sure not something you would expect in a 4* hotel, but, you can feed yourselves quite good till afternoon. Rooms are not big, no carpets in the rooms, heating system is actualy an AC but on the other hand - Rome is never so chilly. Furniture in rooms are basic. So, if you ar on budget, if you dont mind those minuses that i mentioned, you could feel quite okay in this hotel. I would prefer it to less demanding people, but for those who excpect true 4* hotel as it should be - never. Hotel is fairly new & clean, and, that's it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lorrenftw
Reviews.Content: We had initially payed to stay at the Domus Romana hotel up the road, but due to a "mistake" we ended up staying in this place. Firstly, I'd tell you to pay heed to the dates of the poorer reviews, as the hotel has been refurbished since then I believe. The hotel is very modern, and though not to my tastes, it is well decorated and clean. Our stay at the Anglo Americano was okay. Our room was by no means spacious, but it had plenty of space to store our luggage and a weeks worth of clothing and other items we brought along for our stay. The bathroom was always clean, and the facilities were always functioning, despite having a few loose fixtures. Whilst the room itself was clean, the surfaces were fairly dusty, especially by the end of our stay. The breakfast isn't all that. I woke up for it for the first 2 nights, then gave up on it and we ended up buying fruit from the nearby Spar to eat for our breakfast each morning. On 6 occasions we asked for the heating to be turned down in our room, as it was sweltering and we could barely sleep. It never happened, and you can't operate the airconditioning yourselves, and have to ask to have it turned on... They never did that either. Despite this, they were good at giving us tips on which places to eat at (Re degli Amici is fantastic) and they were always friendly. Take note that whilst the website may say the hotel is in a "quiet" road, this is not the case. No road in central Rome is really all that quiet, and being close to piazza Barberini, this place isn't either. But the location is fantastic. Piazza di Spagna is just up the road, and the Trevi fountain, Pantheon and Piazza Navona are all nearby too. We managed to walk everywhere, and though it tired us out, it was good to be close enough to everything to be able to walk to it. Overall, this is a nice hotel. It's not really to my tastes, and after the disappointment of being shoved here after looking forward to staying at the Domus Romana for 5 months, we had a good time, though that's purely down to the hotels location, and all the amazing things we got to see. Finally, I highly reccomend anyone wanting to visit Rome to do it in February. It was always warm during our stay and we had a lovely time and it was hardly crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class”
Reviews.Author: holidaysutd
Reviews.Content: This hotel was brilliant in every way, close to the metro close to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. The hotel staff were very helpful and the breakfast was very good plenty to eat and as much as you wanted. The people who have written negative remarks about this hotel must be very very hard top please or just have to moan about something. To the staff of the Anglo Americano Rome I would like to say as we say in Ireland "gur a mile maith agat"

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Barishka
Reviews.Content: The hotel is indeed recently refurbished, and it is really clean.The standard rooms are pretty small but comfortable.Superior rooms are more spacious,but you only get the Italian tv stations maybe with an additional cost the int'l channels would be available.. The location is also good,it is in between the spanish steps and fontana di trevi..And there also is a subway station right next to the hotel.Out of all the major visiting sites the most far is the Vatican city which takes 45 mins. by walking and you get to see the most of Rome..

Reviews.Title: “Decent option in good location”
Reviews.Author: Ishay27
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is pretty good, as it is very centrally located. The rooms are very basic, though comfortable (my room was even quite spacious, but it may not be the standard). Breakfast is quite basic, and served in a small and crowded hall. There's complimentary cable internet connection in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best location and worst breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: cerise77
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with my husband for 5 nights. It was our 1st trip to Rome so we followed our friend's advice and did not make a lot of researches. We just booked the hotel. Although the hotel seems to be close to Spanish Steps and so on, you still need to walk a lot. Next time I would prefer to stay near Via del Corso. The rooms are clean and renovated but very small. Our room was very hot but we couldn't adjust the temperature. We had to open the window to have some fresh air. The worst of it: the breakfast was included to the price so we decided to try. I have never ever seen such a poor breakfast with extremely dry breads like stone and no toaster available! Horrible machine coffee in the middle of Italy! Cold scrambled eggs in a salad bowl! Tasteless tomatoes! This was basicly it. I felt like they were serving the leftover of another hotel. Normally we are not a demanding couple and we are ok with the hotels most of the time but when the hotel charges for breakfast in the room price they should never ever serve dry bread especially in a so called "4 star" hotel. I would never stay there next time...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: MarcoDessolis
Reviews.Content: Hotel Angloamericano is a great hotel. Elegant end modern. Strategically located close to the Spanish steps and most of the touristic hot spots as well as to the Termini train station. Our room was cosy, spacious and deliciously decorated. Staff was very helpful and friendly, always ready to give very useful advices about places to see , restaurants and transports. The night porter Alessio offered us to charge our phone once discovered I forgot my charger at home. They all were ready to crack few jokes and they really made us feel at home . Price/quality excellent considering the benefits to stay in such a location . I strongly recommend Hotel Angloamericano to everyone who wants to enjoy Rome in the best way.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money spent”
Reviews.Author: Taidel
Reviews.Content: As both of us are both managers working in hotels, we might have been a little bit more fussy, however we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The location was perfect and really several minutes from main attractions. The check in was nice from Alessio, however we sometimes missed the 'good morning' and 'have a nice day'. I try to call several times the reception desk and sometimes tried over 10 minutes until someone picked up the phone. The night receptionist was especially friendly, which I cannot say about a lady who picked up the phone and barely spoke English. The breakfast was quite nice and the room and bathroom exceptionally comfortable. The cleanliness was impecable and met all needs. If we would return to Rome we would consider this hotel again, but maybe chose a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie46176
Reviews.Content: Our two night stay before boarding our cruise ship was great. The staff was very friendly and helped us retrieve our lost luggage from the airlines. The hotel is newly renovated and is situated within walking distance to many attractions, for which they provided a map and advise. Don't hesitate to stay here - we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “BEST LOCATION, RECOMENDED”
Reviews.Author: MichalZinman
Reviews.Content: I think that staying at Hotel Anglo Americano, was a key to our pleasant vacation in Rome, since it is located at Piaza Barberini, close to most sights, and netted with comfortable public transportation, including Metro, elsewhere. we reserved room for four (a couple plus two chieldren). The room was renovated, clean, wide and comfortable. Breakfast was good, great coffee. Helpfull staff. Good value for money. Cheapest price: at the hotel web site: http://www.angloamericanohotel.com Adress: Via delle Quattro Fontane, 12 - 00184 Roma, Italy Phone: +--.--.---- e-mail: info@hotelangloamericano.it Next time in Rome we will stay at the same hotel, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “The accomadation was excellent, new, trendy clean and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Angelite_10
Reviews.Content: During my stay at the Anglo Americano Hotel July/August 2010 was excellent it has all one needs when travelling in Rome. The Hotel rooms are spacious, well equipped, it has a safe in the room to lock your personal belongings, a mini bar, T.V, phone, extra blankets, hair dryer and the rooms are air conditioned. The Hotel is new and tastefully decorated in a prime location walking distance to major tourist attractions and stores. Room service is excellent and the staff are warm, very friendly and extremely helpful providing assistance, guidance and a map for travellers. The Hotel does not have an in house restaurant but provides recommendations. It does serve breakfast from 7.00-10.00 each morning and it’s fresh. It has a variety of hot and cold breakfasts from fruits, cereals to scrambled eggs, croissants, bread rolls and much more accompanied with fresh juices, tea or coffee of all types. Basically what I saw and experienced you can eat and drink as much as you want, its excellent value. I highly recommend the Hotel and personally I will be staying at Anglo Americano when I return to Rome soon! Melbourne Australia

Reviews.Title: “Great location, newly refurbished and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: msallwein
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Anglo Americano Hotel for one week with my elderly parents and was very pleased with the hotel. The hotel is located near Piazza Barberini and many delightful restaurants. We walked to the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps in about 10-15 minutes. The staff was mostly very helpful, some were more informed than others but one night we did get a fabulous restaurant recommendation from them and even though we did not have a reservation, we just mentioned our hotel and they gave us a table right away. The breakfast in the hotel islimited but very typical of most Italian hotels. One perk was the espresso machine where they custom made your drinks. I would return and recommend it for others.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel deserves more stars!”
Reviews.Author: FieroJP
Reviews.Content: We were pleasently surprised with this Hotel. Not expecting much out of a hotel in Rome we entered a newly refurbished and very tastefully decorated place. Our room was on the seventh floor which meant that we had one flight of stairs as the lift goes only as far as the sixth floor. The view from our room was beautifull and the room was that of an upper 4/5 Star. The only criticism I have for this hotel is the breakfast. It is served till ten but if you go as late as nine thirty, most of the stuff is gone. Otherwise, highly recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “A really delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: Attracta
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Anglo Americano is wonderfully situated right beside the Palazzo Bernini and close to many of Rome's most important sites. I found the Reception and waiting staff friendly and helpful. My room ,newly refurbished as is all the hotel, (not quite finished yet in the in the main stairwell but there is a roomy lift) , was spacious and comfortable. A really good shower and mirabile dictu large fluffy toewls made for a blissful sojourn. Despite Rome being very warm the AC ensured restful sleep. I am presuming they still itend to put shelves in the very capacious wardrobe which is redundant without them - my only criticism. Breakfast was good, not a lot of choice but everything was tasty and plentiful. The recepionist ordered me a car to take me to Fiumicino airport and the young man driving was polite and spoke excellent English. To top it all I had got a very good rate so it was all excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “It was Ok, but wouldn't stay again.....maybe if they've remodeled it....”
Reviews.Author: ladybythelake
Reviews.Content: So, this hotel by far isn't the worst, but wasn't the best either. Most of the front desk staff we very, very nice, and some not. That's pretty much anywhere you go. They were happy to make restaurant reservations for us, call cabs, and other favors at all hours of the day and night. The breakfast was pretty skimpy by US standards, but that's Italy, there's an excellent little cafe just down the street that has wonderful food. Go there. :) My room was ok, not the cleanest, but my friends room smelled like musty wet clothes. We got lucky. They changed the linens, and gave us new towels everyday. If the hotel has been remodeled like they say, then I would consider it, but I would probably look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated - nice rooms / will be great when it is finished”
Reviews.Author: lesabre2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with colleagues early in March. Hotel had only re-opened a few days earlier and construction and set up is still ongoing. Room was spotless, newly renovated and reasonably well appointed. Flat screen tv, wireless internet, sufficient electrical outlets plus a small minibar. Only downside was that there was not yet a restaurant or cafe in hotel, so after breakfast (which was quite good), we had to go out for any refreshments desired.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, Rude, Dirty, Old”
Reviews.Author: BrewsterPug
Reviews.Content: The location is good - conveniently between many attractions and transportation. The facility is the worst that we have ever stayed in. It was old - not ancient old...more like 1970's never been updated old. The carpet and beds certainly have not been replaced since the 1970's. It's good that we don't watch TV because it was a 10"x10" tube screen. The carpet was threadbare, stained, and soiled as were the bed linens. The shower head is under 5' so a 6' guy like me has to contort himself to shower. Only PC with internet was not working and they did not seem to care (despite an expensive usage fee) - you'd be better to do your on-line airline checkin at an internet cafe...which is what we had to do since the hotel's didn't work. At least we saved money through the inconvenience. Our son set a glass souveneir, from Murano, out of the way so that it would not get broken but wjole we were out one day, the maids apparently got curious and rummaged through the drawer. They broke it...and the weird part is, they left it out. I mentioned it to the front desk, not expecting anything, but just to let them know, and their response was "no, we did not do that". I might expect this attitude in France but certainly not in Italy. Poor attitude and poor facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: D_Grey
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Anglo Americano for 2 nights on our honeymoon, had stayed previously about 10 years ago and found nothing had been done in the hotel since.. Rooms are very small and dirty, and the public areas could really do with updating. Breakfast was very poor. However the location is excellent, walking distance from all the major attractions like Colosseum, Fontana di Trevi etc. Also handy access to the Metro from Piazza Barberini station which is 2 minutes walk from hotel, which makes the Vatican etc easily accessible. Useful hotel if you're only looking for a bed and will not be spending much time in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: NAAAT
Reviews.Content: The location is very good: easy to walk to many places. We also liked the bed: it was large and comfortable. The room was very basic, looked uncleaned and needed refreshment. The breakfast was poor. The whole impession of the hotel is bad.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location!”
Reviews.Author: blueeyes73
Reviews.Content: ok, i wasnt expecting much in terms of the room, and the room was at least clean and tidy. nothing was new or fancy or particuarly modern. however, our room location was quiet given the part of rome we were in, which is quite busy. this is an excellent location in terms of proximity to the metro line and all the major attractions on this side of town. everything was within walking distance! i have to say that as a tip, this place was so close to the train station barberini that when we needed to go to the toilet, instead of paying at the train stations or other locations, we went straight back to our hotel room!!! that is how close to the line it is and with the convenience of metro trains running every 5 minutes, it wasnt a long ride. the people at this hotel can be a little rude, but its italy and no one is particularly welcoming, but we went to italy for italy and we knew the people werent necessarily going to be welcoming to tourists. on the whole, the breakfast was average bt we didnt go there for breakfast, we really chose the hotel for its location and price and for what we paid for, it served its purpose and was at least very very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Is OK”
Reviews.Author: yuid
Reviews.Content: After booking and only then reading these reviews, I was very concerned, expecting the worse, and ready to absorb a total-loss if the room was indeed as bad as the reviews declare. We were ready for a disaster, and plesantly surprised. [] The rooms are small, no pics etc, but sheets& towels were clean and replaced daily. [] The bath&shower were clean & had plenty of hot water. [] The location is excellant, and everything's within walking distance. [] All the staff were polite & friendly to us. [] Breakfast is adequate: toast,buns, boiled eggs, coffee, juice, cornflakes, ham & cheese. No fresh fruit/veg. [] It definately shouldn't be ranked as a 4star hotel...more like 2-3, so if you tune your expectations accordingly - you'll most probably enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “mezzo mezzo”
Reviews.Author: annalisa_greece
Reviews.Content: We booked hotel angloamericano, although I've seen the terrible reviews.. We stayed in a triple room, which was spacious for three people,with comfortable beds. The furniture was old and although the bathroom was clean, the faucet and bath tub were so old that they looked dirty. The rooms must be renovated, but most hotels in Rome are very old, so the same thing happens everywhere as i hear from friends.. Nevertheless, they changed the towels every day and the sheets once every two days. The reception floor was very clean and decorated with class. The breakfast was excellent. There were croissants, jams,yogurts,bread,toasts, chocolate, cereal, cheese,ham,delicious espresso cofee and many other things! Most importantly, the hotel is situated just 1 minute from piazza barberini and barberini metro station..You can go everywhere on foot, 5 minutes to Fontana di Trevi, 8 minutes to Piazza di Spagna, 7 minutes to piazza de la republica.Also,most buses stop in piazza barberini and there is a taxi station at the piazza.There are lots of fine restaurants near the hotel, as well as shops, boutiques, a pharmacy that stays open 24/7 just around the corner, gelatterias etc..The location is stunning!! In a few words, don't expect luxury..It's good value for money, surely not a 4 star,but adequate and within walking distance from all the sights and monuments..

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump”
Reviews.Author: OssettBloke
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here (as part of a group booking) in the first weekend in October 2008. Not only is the hotel scruffy and badly in need of refurbishment, the staff are rude. It is closer to one star than four star. A word of advice: dont leave your key at reception - we did, and to our cost we found that when we were out, someone let themselves into our room and helped themselves to the contents of our (locked) suitcase. The reception staff were not interested in helping us, they just told us to go to the police station. The room next to ours was also broken into, the thieves stole their passports. This obviously ruined our holiday. Their website states "The handsome decor of the hotel Anglo Americano Rome is of a classical style and very elegant." - this is a joke. It is very tired, carpets are stained throughout. Breakfast was awful, plastic cutlery, not enough tables. The WORST hotel we have ever stayed in, and we have stayed at many. Couldnt wait to leave. Summary: AWFUL, my advice is dont stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in Rome?!”
Reviews.Author: ChocolateRain
Reviews.Content: It's rated 4 stars which is completely wrong! The hotel is in need of complete refurbishment. Everything is old. Carpet is old and stained. Staff are rude. Avoid! It's location is the only good thing as you can walk to most tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: KN1974
Reviews.Content: We've just return from Rome staying at this hotel. This hotel is definitely not a 4* hotel. The rooms are very, very old, very small, the bathroom was small. This hotel has never been renovated, the carpet was so dirty and the walls thought their going to fall over you. Fortunately the sheets and towels were clean. The breakfast was very poor just the usual, cheese, bread, butter, marmalade and yogurt, as a vegetarian I didn’t have much choices, but they had a very good coffee. The location was great thought that's why we had a beautiful time on our vacation. I believe we didn’t get what we paid for 170 euro per night. Anyway Rome is magnificent and everyone has to visit it at least once.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: JimYork_England
Reviews.Content: If you're thinking of staying at the Anglo Americano, don't! Whatever price is being charged it'll be too much. As soon as you check in and meet the rude and arrogant staff it gives you a sense of what's to come. The carpets are filthy both in the rooms and corridors as are the bedspreads, and all the internal walls are a fibre board slot system [very noisy]. The rooms are small, dirty and inadequate. Only one socket for general use, the AC doesn't work, the shower is fixed at chest height and you can only lie down in the bath if you're shorter than 5"! At breakfast you pick up your school dinner tray, put the bad buffet on your plastic plate, your juice in your plastic glass and eat with your plastic knife fork and spoon! During our stay [3 nights] a member of our party had their camera, phone and i-pod stolen from the room. There was no sign of a break in, the room had been entered using a key. The same had happened to a couple in the next room. The staff were completely dis-interested and we were told the Police would not attend the Hotel, you had to go to them even though entry was with a key! No comfort was given by staff, no explanation or compensation and no internal actions taken. This Hotel is not worth 1 star, let alone 4.Even though the location is good stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: rachelsstudio_com
Reviews.Content: I was very leery of this hotel after reading the reviews, but my Swiss friend booked it for us, so I plugged my nose and jumped in. Glad I did! We had a very quiet room that had pleasant views. The breakfast was great. It was a few minutes' walk to the Trevi Fountain, and it wasn't THAT tiny, especially for a European hotel. I would definitely stay here again. Yes the TV is small but we never turned it on so that was not an issue. Also the bathroom was nice with fresh looking blue tile. There was some mildew (very tiny bit) but who the heck cares you're in ROME!!! And the service was better than the ‘4 star’ hotel I got stuck in when my flight got delayed – they carried our bags up to our room and were pleasant throughout the stay. I'm giving this an above average rating because for the money, we had a great location, a comfortable, quiet room, friendly service, and a hearty breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “The Roman Hole.”
Reviews.Author: capitao1
Reviews.Content: Do not bother staying here. Horrible dirty rooms with electrical sockets hanging off the walls. The shower in the bath was about 5 foot high, so I had to do the limbo when showering!! (Shower curtain was also dirty) The carpet in my room was so filthy I was scared to put my bare feet on it. The hotel staff were rude and you had to eat breakfast with plastic cutlery. I travel a lot with my job and I can honestly say this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in!!!! Do yourself a favour and find somewhere else. On a plus note the location is very good if you don't mind staying in a [--] hole.

Reviews.Title: “This is a very poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: deepblusea2212
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in Via Barberini, next to the Spanish Steps. As such, the owner/operator sits on "his or her laurels" and frankly could'nt give a hoot about the hotel standards, its cleanliness, lack of air conditioning, frayed carpets, leaking shower handles, 10" TV's, exposed electrical wiring, POOR lighting, exposed air conditioning control panel, a safe as big as my mobile phone and breakfast food Iwould NOT feed my enemy's dog! Enough said ...... look a the photos. The proof is in the pudding. BEWARE ..... do NOT stay here unless you really do not give a hoot about the state of a decent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star but not the Hotel from Hell either”
Reviews.Author: tnc1969
Reviews.Content: Our timeshare booked this hotel for us. After reading some of the terrible reviews, I was quite nervous about what to expect. The hotel is definitely not a 4 star. It may have been at one time. It is obvious that the owners have not spent much on updating the hotel. It's a shame, because some new carpet and paint would go a long way to brighten it up. Our room was large but drab and outdated.. That said, the bed was comfortable and the linens clean. The bathroom was large, very clean. It had bright blue and white tile, so did not seem as depressing as the room. It had a tub with shower, hot water and clean linens every day, so we were happy with that. Yes, the tv was small, but who goes to Rome to watch tv? Our room overlooked a busy street, so there was alot of street noise, traffic and people. Many of the reviews addressed the buffet breakfast. There were a variety of breakfast choices and the menu did not vary the whole week we were there. The breakfast area was crowded, and the ambiance was zero, especially with the plastic utensils and bowls. They did have staff who would make espresso and cappucino, which was a plus. But the whole experience was like eating in one of the breakfast areas in a budget US motel. We tought the desk staff, though not overly friendly, were helpful, and never rude. When we checked in, the tv was not working ( we liked to catch CNN at bedtime hoping to hear good news about the value of the dollar). I went to the desk to report it and a porter was asked to follow me up to the room to check it out. Our room was on the 3rd floor, but I always use the stairs. The young man ,obviously not happy about walking up 3 flights of stairs, muttered in Italian as he followed me to my room. The tv was beyond his repair. The desk clerk offered to move us to another room, but we declined. The tv was fixed the next morning. The location of the hotel is a big plus. We walked to all the major attractions. It seems there are crowds of people on the streets at all hours, and we always felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: ForceRugbyfan
Reviews.Content: This was our final European hotel of eight in a trip through Scotland, Paris, Switzerland and Italy. It was the most expensive, and the worst by far. Our room (in fact, the whole hotel) was shabby and poorly maintained. The room TV was tiny, and did not work properly, the walls were scratched and dirty, the carpet was stained and the bathroom dark and dismal. The advertised internet access was not wireless, but only available on the one computer in the downstairs TV lounge. Don't be fooled by the website photos of the breakfast room showing nicely laid tables with steel cutlery - the rooms are cramped, the breakfast very basic and the only available cutlery is plastic (we had to take 3 knives because we usually broke one or two trying to cut the hard rolls!). It is a disgrace advertising this as a four star hotel - it is a poor two star. -Disappointed Aussi

Reviews.Title: “hotel from hell”
Reviews.Author: pige0n
Reviews.Content: This hotel maybe a 4 star in the third world but tor central europe it is most definatly a disgrace.With over 20 million people visiting Rome per year there should be more than enough money to buy new carpets instead of painting the bare floor the same colour to try and mask it.The hotel is so run down they give you plastic knives and forks in case you try to do away with yourself!!! I honestly thought i was on candid camera !!!

Reviews.Title: “basic”
Reviews.Author: gg309
Reviews.Content: The only positive things I could tell about the hotel is its location, and the large choice offered for breakfast. First of all, the staff wasn't kind, especially at the front desk. The TV was very small and located in the high corner of the room, breakfast was served with plastic forks and knives and there was a line for breakfast. (self service: about 5-10 minutes before eating) The bathroom was tiny. However, the location is great, close to many touristic sites.

Reviews.Title: “Stay On The Street Corner Instead If You Have To!!”
Reviews.Author: jkivo1
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel I ever stayed in. Bathrooms were small, uncomfortable, and dirty. Smell from a nearby bathroom emanated into our room. Beds were terribly uncomfortable. Loud rooms as busy streets line each side of the hotel. Unfriendly staff. 1 star hotel at best.

Reviews.Title: “DONT DO IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: smrushe
Reviews.Content: Seriously readers please please pay heed to the negativity as this has to be one of the worse hotels I've ever had the misfortune to stay in! Location may be one thing, but really can not comprehend others who would sacrifice good manners, basic hygene and comfort - whilst there are lots of decent hotels (at reasonable prices) centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Anglo Americano”
Reviews.Author: Markieparkie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was definitely not a 4 star hotel but was more than adequate and very good value for money. The location was excellent we could walk everywhere. The room was basic but clean. The breakfast was excellent - continental but plenty of choice and you could eat as much as you liked. The staff were really friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Italian hospitality?”
Reviews.Author: snusken
Reviews.Content: On our last evening in Rome, our security locker was opened and all our money was stolen. The security locker was not forced open, so we had the dubious distinction of being robbed by an aristocrat among burglars. The Police were naturally informed. On our departure from Hotel Anglo Americano, the Manager informed us that he would take care of this unfortunate incident. The hotel`s insurance company would take care of everything. However it would take some time, about 2 months. Now 6 months have passed and we still haven`t heard a word from Hotel Anglo Americano. We have sent emails to both the Manager and the hotel which they refuse/don`t bother to answer. To say we are extremely unimpressed with the hotel management is not an overstatement. Is this what they call Italian hospitality?

Reviews.Title: “warning do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: vinotraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the anglo americano for 3 nights on our last leg our Italian holiday before flying back to Australia, it really spoiled the end of a fantastic experience in Italy. The rooms where filthy all the skirtings looked like they where being eaten by white ants the bathroom was full of mould and the breakfast is put together with no care factor and the staff at the desk are rude and unapproachable. We tried to find other accomodation but it was a busy time of year other staff at oher hotels told us that the hotel is one of the worst in rome and they rate themselves 4star. We have complained to flight centre to not reccomend this hotel to other travelers.Do your self a favour and pay a bit extra for a nicer hotel. We have the hotel for next year already picked. Narla

Reviews.Title: “Terribly overrated”
Reviews.Author: beksi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated as a 4 star hotel but it's barely worth 2 stars. The rooms are in bad condition, and there is even mold on the walls and on the ceilings at least on the ground floor. Furnishing is totally outdated. The breakfast is quite poor (and there is plastic cutlery!). The staff is quite helpful, and the location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Airconditioning but this hotel is not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: HJMoore
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in numerous hotels in Rome and the rest of Italy, we selected this hotel based on location. Location is great, within easy walking distance of most of the tourist attractions. Downstairs the hotel looks OK, however the 3rd floor is pretty appalling and looks like it's not been decorated in 20 years. Carpets are threadbear and dirty, and bathrooms have seen much better days, infact the bath had been scrubbed so many times it had the texture of sandpaper - great if you want to exfoliate your backside! Bedlinen and towels were clean and the air conditioning was good but couldn't say anything else positive about the hotel. Breakfast was worse than any other hotel I've ever stayed at (including 2 star ones). Staff were incredibly rude, I had my AMEX card thrown at me as it wouldn't swipe in the machine at checkout. I would not recommend this hotel, there are much better 2 and 3 star hotels in Rome with better facilitlies than this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kindj
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews of this hotel before going and was prepared for a rotten experience. From the moment we checked in until the time we left the staff was incredibly courteous. We received a fax while we were out one day and the man at the desk had it and our key in his hand before we even asked for it. The hotel has not been updated recently but that it is not what my husband and I cared about. We wanted some place to sleep, shower, and have breakfast. The breaksfast room was very pleasant and the food was abundant, even after the group of 20 students traveling had eaten. The metro station was right around the corner giving us access to all of Rome and it was also nicely located for walking at night to see the Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon. If you are looking for luxury this place is not for you, if you are looking for a solid hotel for a good price, the Anglo Americano is for you.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel Actually!”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel26
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews on this site, myself and my friends were dreading our trip to Rome. However, our experience of this hotel was positive. I agree, it is by no means a 4*, but what can you say for the money and the location. The staff were very friendly and the reception/breakfast area are pleasant. It is quite normal to have deli meat for breakfast in Europe. They had a fresh coffee machine, you don't get this in all hotels so come on guys! I agree the rooms were a little shabby and need a bit of TLC, but the beds and bathroom were clean and that's all that matters when you are in a city like Rome, you wont be spending much time in there anyway. If you pay 4* prices then you expect 4* but this hotel was cheap and cheerful. I think because they rate themselves as a 4* they are getting so much negative feedback. If the hotel admitted it was only 2* then people wouldn't complain so much. I would stay there again but i wouldn't be so impressed if i was there for a romantic break. Don't be put off by all these bad reviews like we were, it's ok really.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap nasty hotel”
Reviews.Author: CIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a night and it was too long. I have stayed in better hostels and do not believe this is a four star even by its own standards. We stayed here after returning from our honeymoon. The staff are rude, the rooms are very small and nasty. The carpert is cheap, curtains awful and the beds were uncomfortable. The tv has no English stations and the air conditioning did not work. The breakfast was self service and consisted in taking things out of boxes that the staff had placed on the tables. I have eaten better breakfast in canteens in hostels 15 years ago. The tables were not cleaned between people eating at them. The best part was the plastic knifes and spoons that were available. My advice would be to stay any where else with the exception of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Ever”
Reviews.Author: Globe24/7
Reviews.Content: Booked here for 5 days and checked out after one. It is certainly not a 4 star hotel (1 if lucky) and yes the location is okay but the road outside is very busy. Dirty room, mould on the walls and everything very tired. Even the staff are very unhelpful. Will never return.

Reviews.Title: “The worst!”
Reviews.Author: Notrayandsue
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so bad, we signed up to Trip Advisor just to alert other to how bad it is! Staff too busy to attend to you and rude with it. The rooms were dirty and shabby - polystyrene ceiling tiles, torn seat covers and old and worn out varnished pine panels on the walls. We never went barefoot and were scared to look in the cupboards. The bed felt as if it had been slept in at the time of Ceasar Augustus. One to avoid at all costs. Yuk!

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: cristalncasper
Reviews.Content: I think that most people seem to miss the point. This hotel has a great location and the accomodations are ok. Let's be practical, we were 2 adults and 1 child (10 yrs) we use the hotel to sleep, get cleaned up and relax in between walking around. The hotel was clean, the room was small but lets face it. this is downtown rome, like Mahatten, Hong Kong, London, space is at a premium. If you understand real estate then you realize that for $300 canadian you wont get 100 Sq.M. The staff were fine and helpful, the breakfast was typically european, lots of carbs(breads) lots of cheeses and meats and tonns of coffee. They did have cereal for the kids and milk and O.J. what more do you people want. stop whining. I work hard for my money just like all of you but I am honest enoght to know that this hotel doesn't sell itself as the Tajh Mahal. It has a great location, great restaurants around it and is within 7 minutes of major sites and shopping. A similar room in NY, London or Hong Kong would cost double. I enjoyed our stay so much we are going back this year.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable for the wrong reasons!”
Reviews.Author: susiekUk
Reviews.Content: 4 stars, it is not. Central it is. Our first room had a leaking bath and traffic noise that would have woken the dead. We were moved to a room at the side of the hotel, which was quiet except for one night when we had a mad man walking the floor above most of the night and thumping something at frequent intervals! The wardrobe had parts of it peeling off and stations on the TV had to be changed by hand. The remote control didn't work. Having brought our laptop computer, the only place to charge it was the shaving socket in the bathroom. The hotel does not cater for the electrical charging needs of the 21st century. Breakfast was interesting. The staff were thoroughly bored by having to cater for these annoying people called guests. We were in the hotel for 14 nights so were able to observe their complete disdain for us and our fellow guests. The ultimate example of this was when, while lining up to serve myself at breakfast a waitress pushed in front of me to grab a piece of cheese off a serving dish and shove it in her mouth! A drab and dilapidated place. Not to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed in. 2* not 4*”
Reviews.Author: Sparra
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible. Please don't be fooled by the 4 stars it has given itself. The building is old as expected but very very tired. From our room we could hear the water works from all surrounding rooms. The shower head in our room was only shoulder height. I was infomed by the hotel and other guests that all rooms were the same. The bed was uncomfortable. The air con didn't work and the satellite TV did not have any English or American channels, not even a news channel. After our rom had been cleaned one day, an item of our clothing went missing. I pointed this out to reception, suggesting it may have been taken with the linen. The housekeeper checked our rom for the item and I was told the linencompnayhad also been contacted but I was told the item was not there. As far as the hotel was concerned, that was the end of the matter. I requested to speak to the manager, who was unable to speak to me for two days. On the third day, the item suddenly appeared in a labled plastic bag back in our room. Breakfast is poor. No otherfacilities (although we knew this before we booked) The only postitive is that the location is good but on a weeks visit, some hospitality would have been nice!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: IrishLass_80
Reviews.Content: Our room was small, a bit dated but comfortable. And the bathroom was impeccable. The hotel location was a huge plus - close to metro, Trevi fountain and Spanish Steps. There are a number of good restaurants around the area. I found the staff to be very pleasant and spoke excellent English. Breakfast was adequate, cold buffet – dining area was a bit small and it got very busy at the peak of the morning rush. It's not a fancy hotel but it was certainly nice enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very poor!!”
Reviews.Author: Greedydog
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in literally dozens of hotels throughout the UK and Europe for both business and pleasure and this hotel must rank as far and away the worst. The room itself was dirty, smelly with a terribly threadbare carpet (with actual holes). Although we booked a double what we got was in fact two beds pushed together (which was fun since one was significantly higher than the other) The staff were rude and arrogant prefering to talk amongst themselves rather than acknowledge your presence and the breakfast was very, very poor. I wouldn't consider staying here again for free.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 79walshie
Reviews.Content: What can we say.... This was the worst hotel that we have ever seen!My husband and i arrived in Rome in the late evening,so we were happy that the hotel didnt mind us checking in late. On the outside it looked good,so we were happy.When we checked in & went into our room we we were suprised to be given a room with two single beds,after booking a double room. Soon enough we were then put into a double room.But this time we were given a room with two single beds again!!!! but they were put next to each other??But on top of that our room stunk so much on urine that we couldnt handle it!!Also it had paint peeling of the wall,the safe didnt work,we found two cockarochs in our room,and it wasnt clean. so we had to complain AGAIN!!! They had no more double rooms so we were put into another single bed room,but with three single beds!!Again our room was not up to standards,had a funny urine smell and wasnt clean enough.....come on it was suppose to be a four star! We were suppose to stay two nights,but checked out the next morning.Breakfast was very basic,service was very rude,especially because we were leaving.I could go on and on but ill leave that to when i make a formal complaint to the hotel and get my money back for the night we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Desaifamily
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location. It is situated close to most tourist attractions, bus-stops, Metro stations and taxi stands, and yet is in a quiet area. The worst thing about the hotel is the reception staff. They are unwelcoming, rude and disinterested in providing any information to the guests. Everything else about this hotel falls in between these two extremes. The rooms were adequate: we had asked for a triple room, and we got two rooms with a connecting door. But the rooms and the corridors can do with re-decorating. The breakfast room is nice, and the breakfast, though cold, is sumptuous and has variety which we found wanting in other Italian hotels.
