If you are not expecting luxury, this hotel gives value for money. But would I stay in this hotel the next time I am in Rome? I don’t think so. I would prefer to try another hotel which might have friendlier staff at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Better then expected”
Reviews.Author: jkiwi2
Reviews.Content: Was wanting to stay in one of the better reviewed hotels in Rome, but due to nothing available our travel agent arranged us to stay in the Anglo Americano. We were both on a Europe tour for 4 months. After travelling for 1 month from Turkey and greece we arrived in Rome early on the train. When we arrived early at the hotel the room was ready and we were really happy that we were able to check in early at no extra cost. The room was good for europe standards although it was abit dated it was comfortable. Location was a plus. Close to the metro and alot of the sightseeing hop on buses. Easy for tour groups to find you for pick ups. Close to the Trivi fountain and spanish steps. Good restaurants around. Service was good for our stay and the breakfast was sufficiently well expected. Rome is an expensive city to visit so on those notes the Anglo Americano worked out to be good value for what we paid in Roman standards. Probably would recommend it to others as a good alternative to people on a slight budget.

Reviews.Title: “hated it”
Reviews.Author: kathrynmh
Reviews.Content: hotel angelo americano in rome it was the worst hotel for a rating of 4 the rooms were noisy and the carpet was thread bare and the quality was the worst beds narrow and breakfast was like a coles caffateria never recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: nzsunlover
Reviews.Content: I had read all the bad reviews, but needing a family room (and not wanting to pay a fortune) meant we didn't have much choice. Check in was fine, no problems. Our room slept 4, 4 single beds. My husband & I pushed our beds together. It was clean and tidy, and was cleaned everyday. The staff were friendly (maybe speaking what little italian we could helped - we always said please, thank you, hello, goodbye, yes, no in Italian).They had just got WIFI internet access and were having problems with it, but once it was going they were happy enough to help us use it. Our children quite often collected our key when we got back each day and the reception staff were friendly with them. Breakfast was ok. Never had a problem there either. It's not fancy but it was certainly nice enough for us. Location was good. We walked to most of the sites in Rome (even the Vatican).

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: shager11
Reviews.Content: well, not REALY 4 stars but reasonable hotel, our room was clean and safe (floor 5)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, otherwise less than okay”
Reviews.Author: NthanNewJersey
Reviews.Content: The location is really good as it is indeed very close to a metro stop and a short walk to the spanish steps. The breakfast was pretty good too. The staff was not very friendly. They told us that the phone wouldn't work in the room for calling cards since it wasn't a touch tone phone. The phone was indeed a touch-tone phone (but calling cards didn't work even though we tried a couple different ones!!). The staff seemed disinterested in helping us make a phone call. There were some water stains on the ceiling in the room as well as in the bathroom. The bathroom was clean but the shower curtain has some mildew. The water pressure was very good. The beds were extremely firm. In summary, I may stay here again if I was in a bind since the location was good but I would start-off looking elsewhere!!

Reviews.Title: “Dont Do It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kpix
Reviews.Content: Wow...where do I start. I read the review on trip advisor and against almost everyone advise, we still booked this hotel thinking "We have stayed in European and Italian hotel rooms, it can't be that bad." It was awful! First off, the staff is not the least bit interested in assisting you with anything. The room's drop ceiling isn’t an issue, but the mold on the drop ceiling was pretty disturbing. The room had a very strange odor...which we later discovered after a nights sleep that there was some candy or 'something' left in an ashtray. (Nasty maple syrup smell) It was all around disgusting. The sheets felt like that had been soaked in starch and were very itchy...and after walking around hot, muggy weather, the last thing you want to do is lay down on 25 thread count sheet soaked in starch. Please do yourself a favor and do NOT book this hotel. (The only thing good about this hotel is the location and the breakfast wasn’t that bad.)

Reviews.Title: “Awful!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gmartins
Reviews.Content: Despite its good location, near Piazza Barberini, that´s a terrible hotel, probably the worst where I have ever been all over the world. I spoke Italian, but everyone of the crew answered in Spanish or English. When we were resting on the room at the afternoon, the chambermaid knocked at the door and pratically sent us out. Almost all the information about the city we asked for, was given wrong(in purpose). When I asked the receptionist for the adress of Ralph Lauren store in Rome, she cynically answered (at this time, in Italian): "Why do you need to buy a Ralph Lauren shirt?". A group of noisy teenagers that were at the next room didn´t let us sleep about midnight , and the crew did nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star but worth its money”
Reviews.Author: holidaymaniacs
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews I had prepared myself and fiancee for the hotel from hell but the price was reasonable and the location seemed the one thing that everybody thought was good so we decided to take the risk. The risk was worth it. Our room was spacious enough with good view. It definetely needs redecoration but it was clean in every aspect and all we wanted was a bed to sleep since oyr main goal was shopping and the attractions for which it was very convenient since you couls walk in most of the places. Indeed the staff were not volunteering to help but there was someone to carry our bags, they stored them safely since we had a late flight and we left the hotel at 20.00 at night and they booked as limousine taxi to and from the airport for 45 euros each way. I liked the breakast even though I would reccomend going early or late due to the lack if tables to accomodate everybody at once.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck!! ”
Reviews.Author: Midwesterner88
Reviews.Content: I'm normally pretty tolerant when I stay at overseas hotels, but I had some real problems with this place. It is not a four-star hotel. The small lobby is nice enough but when you get to your room get ready for "distressed motel" quality. The carpet and walls are dirty and furnishing very old. Amenties? Forget it. There is a mini-fridge and a hair dryer, which is some sort of strange contraption with a long rubber hose attached. There was air conditioning but it was noisy and blew directly onto our third bed. We had to go out and buy a box of tissues for the tiny bathroom. The shower head was mounted on the side of the bathtub stall (instead of at one end) and was situated at chin level -- so practice showering on your knees! The breakfast consisted of some tired looking ham and cheese, rock-hard buns, yogurt, some sort of orange-colored water, canned fruit cocktail, and some kind of sickly-sweet cereal which I couldn't identify. The front desk staff, with the exception of one young man, were curt and unhelpful, and seemed intent on ignoring you for as long as possible. We were paying a lot of money for a triple room and I just feel this kind of contempt for your customers is not acceptable. As others have mentioned, the location is the only good thing about this place. It's about a 10-15 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon or Spanish Steps area. You can also walk to the Colosseum -- it takes 35-40 minutes but it's an interesting walk. The Barberini subway stop is around the corner, as is an internet cafe. Lots of restaurants and shopping in the Trevi/Pantheon area. Unless you are really desperate, or get a great deal on this place, avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in Europe”
Reviews.Author: rooneyred04
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel in Europe bar none. Walls paper thin, mouldy ceiling polystyrene tiles, bathroom dirty with a shower curtain which stuck to you every time you got in because of the size of the room, plus the shower head was broken so the bathroom was soaking after every use. Dirty carpets with 1970s style bed linen with a smell to match. Lumpy bed, broken air con, windows did not shut correctly, TV 10" screen not tuned in correctly, very small safe fits 2 passports at a push, terrible boot style camp breakfast with miserable staff. Unfortunately, they found our booking on arrival even if it did take them 2 hours. Do not stay here under any circunstances - even the location is nothing to shout about. Absolutely awful - you would be best to take a sleeping bag rather than use the bed linen.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotell From Hell”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked over the internet because of the pictures and location, as well as the low rates for a supposedly four-star hotel. Well, it turned out to be hell on earth for us. The staff on duty the night we checked-in was obnoxiously rude. The bellhop kept on complaining about having to bring our bags up. Not even a ten euro tip could bring out a smile from his face. And then we entered our room...or what they passed-off as one. We compared the pictures on the net with our room. They even had the same bedspreads and drapes, but the picture must have been taken in the 1970s from the condition the room was in. And when we asked to be transferred to another room because the airconditioning wasn't working and our room reeked of cigarette smoke (we specified non-smoking in our reservation), we were told to open the windows because it was springtime! We used up the rest of our waking ours on the net (the only good thing about the hotel was that it was close to a wi-fi hotspot) booking anoher hotel to move to in the morning. We hurriedly checked out after breakfast (which was another horror story itself) and brought our bags down ourselves. When we asked to have a cab called, they said call one ourselves! Again, we had to give ten euros to the bellhop to call a cab before we were finally out what we now fondly call the "Hotel-From-Hell" but not before witnessing a white caucasian male having a heated argument with the front desk because he had been waiting for a couple of hours in the lobby already for his room to be ready. I wouldn't even recommend the hotel to my enemies!

Reviews.Title: “Under standard of a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: TobTob
Reviews.Content: We was firstly informed by our travel agent that they were booking a 4-star hotel for us, so we do expect to get a 4-star standard hotel. However, when we arrived Anglo Americano, I'm quite disappointed with the room and docoration. The room is very small and old. I think we can say that there is no docoration at all in the room. You can check the photos I posted. The wallpaper and ceiling had some stains on it. I think it's about time to renovate the hotel. With the money we paid, we do really expect to get a better hotel than this. Breakfast is also disappointing. Just a cold bread, Cheese and Ham. And, a coffee making machine could make a very bad taste coffee. I would suggest you to order the waiter to make one for you from a proper machine. Comparing to the hotels in other countries I've been, Italy could just provide the worst breakfast. One good side of this hotel is that the location is very good, We can just walk to Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. And, it's very close to Barberini Metro Station, so we can easily get to other farther sights.

Reviews.Title: “Could it be any worse”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Has to be the most inefficient and dirty four star hotel this side of the equator. With inadequate staff, heating and beds the hotel failed dismally, even the resident barista served very average caffe. Never again

Reviews.Title: “It's all been said before!”
Reviews.Author: Johngkelsall
Reviews.Content: Great location Very old rooms Boiling hot in April! Only 20 degrees centigrade outside but 6th (top) floor was like an oven - slept with windows fully open 4 star, more like 1 or 2 star Had a single room - single bed and ensuite, not really room to 'swing a cat', but I wasn't there to swing cats, so it wasn't too cramped Mixed staff - some helpful, most arrogant and only helpful when pressed for information Shower / bath taps vibrated like industrial power tools Might stay there again at a push - I did check this website first, and rejected many hotels I had considered. Up to booking this one a couple of months ago comment had been reasonable. I spent most time sightseeing, all I needed was a bed and bathroom - if the room rate is broken down its probably 70% location 30% facilities. Expensive for what you get, but I couldn't find a better alternative at the time.

Reviews.Title: “What's all the fuss about ?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in March. OK, the carpets and decor were a bit worn, but how much time do you spend in the hotel ? Our room was spacious ( 3rd floor )and had a very pleasant floodlit outlook at night. Linen and towels changed daily and the shower was hot and powerful, however we could hear the next door room when in the bathroom ! Breakfast was fine. More than enough food to take you through to lunch or even dinner. Try the resturant 'That's Amore ' for an evening meal. Excellent and only about 5 mins away, near the Trevi fountain. Didn't have much to do with the hotel staff, but found them very polite. It's in an absolutely fabulous location. We walked to all the ' must see ' sights. Minibar prices may be high, but we bought our booze/water from the local supermarket and used the fridge to keep them cool! We loved Rome and would go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT 4 star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before I say anything, I have to say that there is no way this hotel is 4 star! I have stayed in Hotels all over the world, in city centres and tourist resorts and this is definitely the most basic hotel I have ever stayed in. I could not honestly say it was more than 2 Star. We booked through Expedia and therefore expected there to be some form of credibility to the hotel ratings. Interesting, on their .co.uk website, the hotel is rated as 4* but on their .com website it is rated as 2*. When we checked into our room, we here horrified to see the floor covered in a grey, stained, office-like carpet. The wall partitions were extremely thin and we could easily hear the people in the next room talking. The curtains were filthy and stunk. The mini bar was extortionate and you would be well advised to buy a bottle of water from the nearby supermarket at 30 cents then spend nearly 3 Euros on one from their fridge. The bathroom was OK. The shower, however, was tiny and there was barely enough room to wash. As it was so tiny, the shower curtain was permanently stuck to my back and left side whilst using the shower. I did not feel as though I was clean when stepping out once. The only complimentary toiletries provided was bubble bath which was useless in a bathroom with only a shower cubicle. There is only one electricity point and this was not working. We asked to be moved to a new room and it took them 2 days to accommodate this request (we were only there for 3 nights) as they were fully booked for the Rome Marathon. The second room was as bad as the first. It was situated on the 7th floor with elevator access only to the 6th and a window that was so tiny that you could not see out of it unless you stood on something. It was also extremely warm and the air conditioning was not working in late March. The breakfast was OK if you don't mind bread, butter, processed ham, cheese and sickly orange squash masquerading as orange juice. On the plus side, we were provided with fresh towels and linen daily and had a pretty decent coffee at breakfast. Some of the reception staff were quite surly but one middle aged gentleman (I'm afraid I didn't ask his name) who worked in the early evenings was extremely helpful and recommended two restaurants to us that served fabulous traditional Italian/Roman food at reasonable prices, compared with the smutz served at most tourist orientated restaurants. As others have said, the location is good and is around a ten minute walk to both the Spanish Steps or Trevi fountain. If you are relatively fit, there will be no need to get public transport to anywhere in Rome from this hotel. All in all, if you are expecting a 4* hotel, I guarantee you that you will be disappointed. If you are only expecting 2* quality, then I'm sure you could do worse than the Anglo Americano.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and staff were horrible!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel at all! The location is great BUT the rooms are dirty and the staff is very rude and unfriendly! Do not stay here. Keith Gilges

Reviews.Title: “Good ubication and that's it.”
Reviews.Author: Bussines-CA
Reviews.Content: Good ubication and that's it. The rooms and the hotel need a cleaning. The staff could be nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Very good if expectations are managed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Anglo Americano. Here are the positives... Excellent free breakfast by European standards - Decent selection, however, not traditionally "American" breakfast. Lobby and hallways are in good shape, but nothing fancy. Hotel is centrally located near tourist sites in a safe neighborhood. Concierge was knowledgeable, but at times lacked specific details. Rooms vary in size, but are generally clean and relatively quiet. Ask to see another room if your not initially pleased with the one first offered. As for the negatives, room decor is poor, dated and drab. Overall, it's a great place to stay if you're watching your money and you're not expecting a palace.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: mitchmaker
Reviews.Content: I must admit we approached this hotel with more than a little trepidation... we needn't have worried! Everything was excellent from the courteous reception staff to the clean and functional double room. True the hotel is not a 4 star by American standards but we are not in the US so who are we to judge what is 4 star and what isn't? The point is you can have a clean room with private en-suite bathroom in the historical center of Rome minutes walk from everything! Our towels and linen were changed daily and the concierge was very helpful in providing directions to the nearby sights and restaurants (contrary to some previous reviews the Hotel Anglo Americano DOES NOT have its own restaurant) We booked online directly with the hotel at a very competitive rate including breakfast (the breakfast is a little bit paltry but that is the case in most Italian Hotels.) Next Fall we plan to return to Rome and our first choice will be the Anglo Americano.

Reviews.Title: “awful, awful, awful”
Reviews.Author: mostor
Reviews.Content: we atayed at this pit for 3 nights in jan and while not a hotel snob at all, i was horrified by the room we were given. it had doors falling off, the walls were absolutely filthy, bed was dirty and the smell was awful from drains. we were almost afraid to touch anything, i was nearly in tears! reception was very unfriendly and there was no fear of us eating there. we changed rooms and got an even more awful one. the corridors smelled and the carpet was filthy. i really cannot describe how bad it was. there is no way it is a 4 star, even by standards abroad. the only thing going for it was location. it should be closed down on health grounds. it really did affect our weekend as we didn't want to go back to it (unless we'd had a few!)

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Newcastle upon Tyne Tyne and Wear
Reviews.Title: “4 Star Bed and Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: golfhandtcap
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights from 29th dec 2005 until 3rd Jan 2006 and enjoyed each one of them. we had read other reviews and are surprised that as advertised the hotel has no restuarant other visitors expected UK style 4 star accommodation. However it fits the bill as 4 star bed and breakfast with a great front desk service plus linen and towel changes each day. we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what was expected...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was quite possibly the worst "hotel" I've ever stayed in. The room smelled of mothballs and something else that I couldn't possible write on this review. There were two working plugs in the room, one in the bathroom, the other was barely attached to the wall. The tv had no remote control and no buttons left on the front - they had all been broken off. The minibar door would not close which meant there was constantly a wet puddle around it as it defrosted itself and the aircon looked like it came from the sixties - turning the temperature on it down, only served to turn the noise created by it, up! Our double room had two single beds pushed together, dirty sheets upon arrival, dirty walls, filthy carpets and the bath had large chunks of enamel missing from it. It felt like the staff were tolerant of us rather than being there to be of service and were indifferent to our complaints about the room. We stayed with several other couples who reported similarly poor rooms so the issue appears not to be isolated to our room. The location could not be faulted, however, this was the only thing Hotel Anglo American couldn't have any influence on, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone unless they were on an extremely tight budget and they got an extremely good deal - less than 80euros per room MAX. Very, very disappointed. Would probably not make a 1-2 star in the UK, certainly not close to 4 star. Do not be fooled by the photos or the rating.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel but great location !”
Reviews.Author: deirdra_10
Reviews.Content: After reading all the terrible reviews of this hotel we were relatively pleased with the Anglo Americano. Ok, the hotel is not a four star, two star at best, but for what we paid for our 5 day trip we didn't think it was too bad. i must say that the staff were very friendly and helpful, gave us a map on our arrival showing where the hotel was, luggage carried up to our room by the 'Bell Boy' ( ok, the uniform he was wearing looked a bit shabby, but he was polite ) We were on the 4th floor, traffic noise not too bad but if staying on a lower floor this might be a problem as hotel is on a very busy road. Room ok, furniture shabby, old, but clean, bed linen clean and bathroom clean . room cleaned every day , towels changed every day, (although shower cubicle is quite small,) - corridors and stairs were probably the worst looking part of the hotel - need refurbishing. Breakfast was typicaly continental - rolls, pastries, cereals yoghurts, cheeses and hams etc - a bit like a cafetaria but everything was fresh. But the best part is the location - Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps literally minutes away - all Rome attractions are walkable to from the hotel - we walked to St Peters in 40 minutes ( bring a pair of good walking shoes ) Rome is fantastic and in November not as busy as July/August - came in on Ryanair, very good service, got the coach in but beware, a piece of our luggage was stolen from the coach when we arrived at Termini - didn't ruin our holiday though!!

Reviews.Title: “basic but good”
Reviews.Author: anne-rogers
Reviews.Content: myself, husband and our two teenagers stayed at this hotel for three nights in a quad room. Having read the bad reviews on this site we were worried as to what to expect from this hotel. However, when we arrived we were greeted by extremely courteous staff and the porter carried our bag to our room. The receptionist gave us a map and some tour literature and informed us that our breakfast was included. The room was spacious with four single beds, a t.v., radio, stocked mini fridge and wardrobe with plenty of hangers. The bathroom was clean and the towels were changed every day. The bedroom was also cleaned every day and the bed linen was spotless. There is a hairdryer provided in the bathroom. The location is excellent a short walk to the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain and sandwiched between the Metro Station and an art gallery. Tips: Take the metro to San Giovanni a clothes market Mon-Fri 8am-2pm. Sat 8am-5pm It's 4 euro for a full day metro ticket We would stay here again. Breakfast was a buffet consisting of cereal, juice, tea, coffee, hot drinks, rolls, ham, cheese, boiled eggs etc very filling.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the employees!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our safe was ripped right out from the wall by an unknown person while my travelmate and I were out. There was no sign of forced entry and laundry was delivered during the same time of the theft. We think it could have been one of the hotel workers. Their safes are not safe!

Reviews.Title: “Glorified Hostel at Best.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Location, however compared to Irish/American standards of 4 star hotels not good at all. Facilities that were advertised as standard online were non-existent. Staff were very good but were oblivious to any complaints which is probably an Italian thing. The rooms were clean nut very decrepid and the decor and furniture has probably not been updated since the 1970's. This hotel in Ireland would barely qualify as a hostel. The cost was way too much, advantage was taken of the fact that we stayed in september which is peak season. DO NOT PAY more than 80 euro a night for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful hotel,Should not be 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Would advise against staying here. This hotel is in no way a 4 star. It is at best a 2 star. We were charged 170 euro per room. Rooms are run down, smelly, dirty. No proper A/C. A double room is 2 singles pushed together. The TV is tiny and the staff dont want to hear your complaints. Whoever awards the star ratings in Rome need to look at this hotel and review its rating. Its location is good but do not pay more than 80 euro per room, its not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Why is this a 4 star hotel? It was dowdy and the tablecloths at breakfast were not clean. Rolls were served in shabby cardboard boxes and the orange juice was really just coloured water. The safe in our room did not lock and no-one at reception was interested.

Reviews.Title: “Typical European Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling to Europe for the first time, and need to stay within a certain budget, then this is a great place to stay. The location is great, and the staff was very friendly and also spoke very good English. One thing I didn't like was the fact that the beds were INCREDIBLY firm.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Beyond Belief”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Aug 05 and thankfully it was only for 2 nights, the room was shabby, a leaky roof in the corridor meant a towel had to be on the floor outside the room next door to catch dripping water. Breakfast would have been okay had I been able to stomach the smell of drains wafting in the air! Another leaky roof on our floor meant that the stairway looked like a walk in shower there was that much water coming through. Dont be mislead by the pleasant and highly decorated decor of the front lobby and lift - you get a big shock when you get out of the lift into another world. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. This is not even a 2 star let alone 4 star!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel this past summer for 3 nights. 2 before leaving on a cruise and 1 night back from the cruise. This hotel was big disappointment. The rooms were very small compared to American standards. Very cramped quarters for 4 people. Bathrooms and rooms need to be updated and cleaned alot better. We actually found some bugs in the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location ,certainly not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Alye16
Reviews.Content: In a good position and the ground floor interior appearance is good, friendly helpful staff on reception but I'm afraid the positive points stop there. Room for 4 very small with very old furniture looked like a youth hostel. Room safe didn't work. Linen and towels clean. Air conditioning noisy but effective. Poor fitting windows meant outdoor traffic could be heard. Breakfast extremley poor, stale rolls and pastries. Ham and cheese not replaced when it had ran out. Juice very watery. Not the ideal start for a mornings sight seeing. Wouldn't ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book”
Reviews.Author: go_china
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at this hotel (pre-cruise). The staff is OK and can speak/understand English. Breakfast is non-gourmet but met my expectations because I only care for coffee (which is good) and sweet rolls. The Expresso here is not bad either. The reason I don't recommend this hotel is because of the room. Yes, you don't go to Rome because of its hotels but at the end of an exhausted day, you want to look forward to going back to your hotel room to rest. I was dreading that moment! The room is on the 3rd floor. It's small (obviously), old and smell. The mattress is OK if you like hard mattress and the AC works fine. The worst part is the outdated bathroom with a hairdryer that even a museum would refuse. For a few more Euro, I suggest Hotel Genio at the Piazza Navona.

Reviews.Title: “the worst”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: what they referred to as thier suite was a dirty non air conditioned 7th floor room that the a/c broke in and the elevator only goes to the sixth floor. the hotel smells and the staff are crooks and have terrible manners. stay away from this hotel it ruined our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Not where I would want to stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Quite why it has 4 stars is a mystery, they must know someone who gives them out because I have stayed in better 2 stars. Nice folk but my parents cash went missing after vacating their room for less than 5 minutes. When the management was told they said "it often happens!" can you beat that? There was only 2 people on the floor of the room and they both had keys but that didn't impress. We won't go back there, the sheets were clean but the rest needs sorting out as it's well used, a bit smelly and needs serous modernisation and redecorating. Rome was brilliant, but spoilt by the ambivalence of the staff and a poor hotel.

Reviews.Title: “up market hostel”
Reviews.Author: StuartAT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine for people who won't be staying in it. As long as you only need a bed to sleep in this is probably OK. The rooms are tatty but reasonably clean (don't book or accept anything on the 6th floor though!), the beds hard but comfortable if, like me, you like hard beds. The staff are are best civil and at worst rude and clearly have little time for tourists. If this hotel wasn't located where it is, about 3 minutes walkfrom the Trevi fountain, I'd say "stay well away". However, the location is excellent even if the hotel is generally poor. In many ways it sums up Rome perfectly, an outdated, surly rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped Quarters”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location was terrific but the room was awful. There was hardly enough space to open your suitcase. The one chair in the room was very small and still there wasn't room for it. I didn't notice the controls for the radio until the next night because they were jambed up against the bed and you couldn't see them. To give you an idea as to how uncomfortably small the room was, I was looking forward to the spaciousness of the cabin on the ship that we would be sailing on once we left Rome. Breakfast was adequate. The staff were so-so. They were pleasant enough but always seemed rushed.

Reviews.Title: “Central, cheap and clean at the Anglo Americano Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nites at this hotel, was very reticent about stay given the amount of bad reviews this hotel got. However, found it to be very conveniently located to all sights, main shopping, bus terminus. More importantly felt it's location to be very safe and no dodgy areas nearby that would make one feel uncomfortable walking about at nite. The hotel itself was agreeable, in that the decor was a little outdated, but the rooms were perfectly clean and acceptable. Housekeeping was done every morning, beds made and fresh towels put out and toiletries replenished. The staff were pleasant enough, like any large city with high turnover of tourists their manner can appear brisk and abrupt, but where help was sought, it was given. Breakfast was typical continental...cereal, yogurts, cheeses, hardboiled eggs, fresh rolls, crackers, pastries, jucies and endless freshly brewed Italian coffee. I would go by price of room over star rating when selecting accomodation, if it's cheap - 50 euros p.p. per night, then it's not going to be the Ritz. Anyhow, I know I'de never get a hotel with the same service and amenities for the money back home in Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Do not listen to the moaners !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel last November and got a great deal. €45 per person per night for a quad room. I thought this was great value. But then I read some of the negative reviews on this website and started to get really, really worried. However, I could not cancel as I had paid in full online. Much to my relief, the majority of the bad reviews about this hotel were way OTT. My two sisters, my Mum and I stayed here from March 29th to April 4th and were really happy with the hotel. For a quad room, we had loads of space even with all our bags! (Four women!). We had a really clean bathroom, lots of hot water, a TV with BBC1 to keep us updated on the Pope and MTV to entertain as we got ready to head out for the evening, and plenty of fresh croissants and rolls for breakfast in the morning. Some of which we took with us to keep us going during the day while we were sightseeing around beautiful Roma! The hotel is in an excellent location and within walking distance to everything, e.g. all the sights, the shops and the train/bus station. As a result the only taxi we ahd to get during the 5 days was to the Catacombs which are a bit outside of the city. My advice is to ignore ALL of the negative reviews. Trust me. If you are used to travelling around Europe you will know that 4 star is not the same as 4 star hotels in the U.S. This hotel is a very good 2/3 star. For €45 p.p. per night, at Easter, none of our party could fault this hotel on anything! Those moaners obviously had too much spare time on their hands and spent way too much time in the hotel which is hard to believe as there is sooooooo much to see and do in Rome. Get out there and enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough, if you don't raise your expectaions too high!!”
Reviews.Author: SAMY0602
Reviews.Content: The hotel was touted to us as a 4 star in a central location and we chose it over several other cheaper options. We were very apprehensive after reading a few dozen reviews advisng not to stay there. The location is really a big plus. If you are a budget tourist it saves you lot of cab fare. True you got to be lover of tinned fruit in syrup and plastic bowls, but there is a decent choice, Danish, bread, prepacked toast, milk, tea, coffee, cereal, boiled eggs, cheese, butter, jams.... did I say tinned fruit? Our room was spacious, had a working a/c and a tiny fridge but it was ok. There was a mama bear bed and a papa bear bed, not a single double bed. The was a 3rd bed in the double room. The walls are clapboard white with one picture frame and you knew your neighbour forgot his shampoo because its so easy to hear whats being said in the next bathroom. Thre is not enough space to keep your toleteries in the bath, theres a bidet though... the fixed shower is great for kids and vertically challenged.. the TV is a 13" and some channels you can actually see on some it was snowing. There is a decent enough storage space, enough light the styling was 50% industrial 50% street lighting. The staff is pleasant enough but don't expect them to go out of their way. Ahh.. the carpet.. thin and rough.. improves circulation in tired legs.. clean though. Sheets and towels were clean. Clean large window and curtains. Seen worse places in London and Paris.. On the whole an OK place to park your bags, lay your head if you are on budget.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible rip-off, lying descriptions”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 double rooms at the Hotel Anglo Americano in Rome for the night of April 29th. We made this booking in part because the hotel was listed as a 4 star property and listed among its amenities air conditioning and deluxe bedding. We paid $226 for each room – hardly a bargain rate. When we reached the hotel, we were surprised at the cramped and gloomy reception area. However, we have some experience of urban hotels in Europe and this did not at first necessarily seem significant. However, the staff at the desk were brusque, haughty and difficult – making us feel like we were imposing on them by actually showing up to check in for our prepaid rooms. Although a bellman was loitering nearby, he made no effort to help us with our bags – either when we arrived by cab or when we had to drag them into the “lobby” Our keys resembled truck stop restroom keys – with big wooden blocks attached – we were told to leave them when we went out, as if we would steal these things. The elevator dropped and bounced when we got into it – we feared we might be stuck in there. When we reached the second floor, I thought we were in the basement as the hallway was blocked by a metal maids cart, lit with exposed florescent lights, had utility pipes running through it and the walls were dingy fiber board panels with a tin drop ceiling. The rooms were cramped, reeking of cigarette smoke, with dirty grey stains on the walls and mildew, wet rot damage at the baseboards above the stained and dirt saturated old carpeting. No air conditioning was available in the 85 degree heat – contrary to advertisement. Fumes and noise came in through the one small window available for ventilation. The light in the bathroom did not work properly. The beds were tiny, and fitted with scratchy low quality sheets. On the positive side, I will say that the hot water supply was adequate and the bathrooms clean. Breakfast was also adequate. However, this hotel compares unfavorably to a two star hotel in the heart of Paris which I recently stayed in (2002) and which cost a third of the price of this place. I can stay in Manhattan at the Hotel Lucerne on the upper west side close to the Natural History Museum in a boutique hotel with bellhop service, outstanding restaurant and beautiful rooms for less than I paid for this place. If Hotel Anglo Americano of Rome rates 4 stars, please know that 4 stars in Rome equates to a Motel 6 level experience in the States at 4-5 times the cost.

Reviews.Title: “4* for its Location,Location,Location!!”
Reviews.Author: kevjo
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night break and couldn't believe a city centre 4* could be such good value. Then we arrived and realised why! You get what you pay for and we certainly did. The hotel is not up to date in its decor....nor is in keeping with its period. In a word it is shabby! The threadbare carpets and hard beds let it down, as does the en-suite shower that is only fit for people shorter than 5'5"(165cm). Dont even bother having breakfast...tinned fruit in a plastic disposable bowl....I am 31 years old not 4 years old having a jelly and ice-cream party!! The absolute saving grace for thiis hotel is its LOCATION! Via Veneto is a one minute stroll and from there you have a choice of some fine restaurants and bars. Not very Roman in their clientele but very cosmopolitan nevertheless. We would recommend this hotel to those who know what to expect for their money.....it is a functional hotel in a great location........if you like a hard bed!

Reviews.Title: “OK accomodation, location fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay, 2 adults, 2 children - March/April 2005 When I read the reviews, three days prior to leaving, my heart sank. We had booked a quad room for 6 nights. Be heartened though it's not as bad as other reviewers say - but the hotel is basic and does not offer 4 star accomodation. The decoration in the public areas was over the top but clean and always tidy. Our room (411) was simple but spacious, the double and 2 single beds were comfortable and clean. The bathroom was clean too including the shower curtain which is often forgotten. The pillow cases and towels were changed everyday and the sheets were changed once during our stay. Breakfast was a basic affair consisting of tinned fruit, cereals, pastries, rolls, cream cheese, boiled eggs, fruit juice and freshly made coffee. The staff were polite and always available. The air con was hopeless so don't go when the weather is hot. The hotels crowning glory is it's location. It's easy walking (5-20mins) from most of the important sites. The immediate area also has a lot to offer, historic sites - the National Gallery is next door, shops and restuurants. We had a fantastic trip and it wasn't spoiled by the lack of luxury offered by the hotel. Enjoy yourselves it's a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Anglo Americano”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel. Staff rude and surly. Room would have been good 30 years ago. Eat out for breakfast as well.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: bevchris
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in 2002. It was disgusting and I only hope things have improved since then. Our first room had mould on the walls, wallpaper was peeling off the walls. The room and bathroom were dirty. The room stunk. The bed had springs poking through the mattress. The staff were rude, I could go on and on. It is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: PhilDay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 20 feb 05. Can't beieve the other reviews - the hotel's in a great location, rooms were spacious and clean, staff were friendly and helpful. I've stayed in many hotels in Rome, this was one of te best.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four, two adults and two children aged 10 and 8 years. Stayed from 14th to 18th February 2005. Firstly must say that we spent quite some time looking at many hotels on the internet and booked this one last year. We really struggled to find a room for our family at a price that suited. Many of the hotels we looked at were well out of our price range, especially as we guessed that we would spend very little time in the room. Weren't going to spend a lot of money on a room we would hardly see. Glad we booked this hotel prior to reading many of the reviews on this site, otherwise we may not have booked it. First impressions on our arrival were; hotel central to all major tourist attractions, foyer small and tidy. Staff were friendly. Were allocated room 114 just up the stairs from the foyer, at the rear of the hotel. (this meant street noise was negligable) The room was of a fair size and decorated at about the same time as the Colosseum. Must say though, that it was clean and tidy. Air conditioning of a sorts. Four single beds with hard mattresses. (This suited us fine) Sheets and towels were changed every day. Bathroom was clean. Shower was fine for those under 5'5". I had to shower on my knees. If you were in Rome to watch TV then you will be disappointed. We were there to see the odd historic site or two. As long as you expect a continental style breakfast then you will be happy. If you expect a fry up in Rome, then the City is not for you. Again most of the staff were friendly, and fairly polite. One or two may not be early birds though. Overall I would say that the room was fine for what we paid. We did over 12 miles a day walking, and slept well enough to want more the next day. As far as four stars is concerned, they are probably the ones you can see out of the window at night, but as my review title suggests, compare the prices for a centrally located hotel and you can work out that you will not be staying in luxury. If friends asked me to recommend this hotel or not then I would say it was fine for what we wanted, just don’t expect the Ritz! We would go back again as it was value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go near”
Reviews.Author: colctrav
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a while ago - whilst stranded in Rome for a weekend through cancelled flights. Barely acceptable room and bathroom - reasonable size but down at heel, did not look as if it had been redecorated for decades. Breakfast unbelievably bad - tiny over heated room, plastic plates, inedible food. Only plus point is the central location, albeit noisy. You can do a lot better for the money. How this hotel justifies 4 stars is a mystery. To cap it all, on return to UK, found that credit card details had been used for international phone call to the States without my knowledge. Whilst cannot be sure that this originated from the hotel, nevertheless seemed too much of a coincidence. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended -”
Reviews.Author: Barbara_Andy
Reviews.Content: Expected far better from a 4* hotel. Room resonably clean, however, sound of the main road outside leaves you with bleeding ears. Choice of diluted orange or cold coffee for breakfast. Only two t.v. channels in English, and even those weren't turned in properly, spent both nights listening to next doors room Italian channel! Had to go out and stay out late so did not have to suffer the room and traffic/next room noises any more than necessary. Would not recommend at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anne EB
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of this hotel we were considering cancelling our booking. We are very glad we didn't. The rooms were warm and clean - towels changed daily, bedding every other day. Very powerful shower in clean, well equipped bathroom. The beds were slightly hard, but we slept extremely well whilst staying there. Breakfast was not great - but then it was a typical Italian breakfast, exactly what should be expected in Italy!! The decor could do with upgrading, but again it is an Italian hotel, decorated in Italian, not British or American, style. The staff were exceptionally helpful. When we checked in we felt our two rooms were too far apart (we had 2 teenagers with us); as the hotel was full we were not able to move that night. However, the next day we were allowed to look at 2 adjoining rooms so that we could decide if we wanted to move. We did - the views were great. The staff also phoned our transport company on our behalf to confirm our travel arrangements back to the airport, at no charge. The shops and restaurants in the immediate area are excellent, and the hotel is within walking distance of all the major tourist attractions. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in - - by far”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Please believe the other reviews and avoid this hotel at all costs!!!! We too were fooled by the "four star" rating and booked a room at the Hotel Anglo Americana. Disappointed does not even begin to describe our reaction when we were lead to our room, which was just behind the front desk. The room was dirty, the paint was peeling, the beds were old and saggy, the bedspreads stank (as did the water), the furniture was broken, the sheets were old and tattered . . . and I could go on. My daughters and I thought that we were on some hidden camera show and that at any minute someone was going to pop out and tell us it was all a joke and lead us to our "real room." But alas that didn't happen so we got early the next morning and checked out, walked out the front door, turned left, walked up two blocks and found an amazingly hotel across the street - - can't remember the name. And yes, the staff was rude as described in the other reviews. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “the hotel is in a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before we went to Rome last week I read the reviews about this hotel and I just wanted to cancel . However due to the cancellation policy via the web site we booked it through that was not an option without losing alot of money. So we went to the Hotel and it was fine. The rooms need decorating and sound proofing however the staff were friendly and the rooms were very clean. I wouldn't say this was a 4 star however the location was perfect. You can walk to all the major sights from the hotel. I would go back to the hotel and recommend it to friends.
